text: My mom died when I was 8.
author: Lisa Guerrero

text: I'm proud of what I look like. I'm proud that I look like my mom.
author: Lisa Guerrero

text: You know when everyone's watching, your mom and dad, your friends in high school who thought they were better than you. You get your chance to get in the spotlight and shine.
author: Shaun Alexander

text: I finished high school, moved to Nashville for college, and set out to break into the music business. Every night when I called home with news of my experiences, my mom and dad would encourage me to keep taking those small steps.
author: Trisha Yearwood

text: My mom has a good way of engaging me in a conversation about the choices I make, listening, being objective and open-minded, and respecting those choices so long as they don't put me in danger.
author: Casey Affleck
